content.description: Start standing just right of Renaissance Man on high edges. You kind of have to squeeze in between the big boulder and the boulder to the right to find the start. Make big moves up to hard mantle press, don't dab on the boulder behind you. A low start goes at V8.
content.location: This is on the Renaissance Man Boulder.

content.description: Holy crap, this is tall, proud, and legal. Stand start, and go up and left. This is crimpy, has a bad landing, and has bolts on top to toprope!
content.location: It is uphill from Tom Sawyer.

content.description: On the obvious face on the small boulder downhill of the big Renaissance Boulder, sit start with a right crimp and left sidepull. Make a big move to the lip, and top out.
content.location: Downhill of the big boulder, you see this as you walk up to the area.

content.description: Start with a very low right hand sidepull and a low left hand sloper around the arête. Fire up, and move right to top out. For the full grade, start on the lowest holds you can find. If you start higher, it is definitely easier.
content.location: It ascends the uphill, back arête of the boulder.

content.description: Start standing on small edges with small feet, establish, and dyno to the obvious dish. Match and top out.
content.location: In the middle of the north side of the boulder, it is up and left if you are looking Renaissance Man.

content.description: Renaissance  is a large boulder perched on the hillside above a swamp. It is home to some of the hardest problem in Milford.
